16namespace cppgc {
17namespace internal {
18
19namespace {
20
21bool InGC(HeapHandle& heap_handle) {
22 const auto& heap = HeapBase::From(heap_handle);
23 // Whenever the GC is active, avoid modifying the object as it may mess with
24 // state that the GC needs.
25 return heap.in_atomic_pause() || heap.marker() ||
26 heap.sweeper().IsSweepingInProgress();
27}
28
29} // namespace
30
31void ExplicitManagementImpl::FreeUnreferencedObject(HeapHandle& heap_handle,
32 void* object) {
33 if (InGC(heap_handle)) {
34 return;
35 }
36
37 auto& header = HeapObjectHeader::FromObject(object);
38 header.Finalize();
39
40 // `object` is guaranteed to be of type GarbageCollected, so getting the
41 // BasePage is okay for regular and large objects.
42 BasePage* base_page = BasePage::FromPayload(object);
43
44#if defined(CPPGC_YOUNG_GENERATION)
45 const size_t object_size = ObjectView<>(header).Size();
46
47 if (auto& heap_base = HeapBase::From(heap_handle);
48 heap_base.generational_gc_supported()) {
49 heap_base.remembered_set().InvalidateRememberedSlotsInRange(
50 object, reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(object) + object_size);
51 // If this object was registered as remembered, remove it. Do that before
52 // the page gets destroyed.
53 heap_base.remembered_set().InvalidateRememberedSourceObject(header);
54 }
55#endif // defined(CPPGC_YOUNG_GENERATION)
56
57 if (base_page->is_large()) { // Large object.
58 base_page->space().RemovePage(base_page);
59 base_page->heap().stats_collector()->NotifyExplicitFree(
60 LargePage::From(base_page)->PayloadSize());
61 LargePage::Destroy(LargePage::From(base_page));
62 } else { // Regular object.
63 const size_t header_size = header.AllocatedSize();
64 auto* normal_page = NormalPage::From(base_page);
65 auto& normal_space = *static_cast<NormalPageSpace*>(&base_page->space());
66 auto& lab = normal_space.linear_allocation_buffer();
67 ConstAddress payload_end = header.ObjectEnd();
68 SetMemoryInaccessible(&header, header_size);
69 if (payload_end == lab.start()) { // Returning to LAB.
70 lab.Set(reinterpret_cast<Address>(&header), lab.size() + header_size);
71 normal_page->object_start_bitmap().ClearBit(lab.start());
72 } else { // Returning to free list.
73 base_page->heap().stats_collector()->NotifyExplicitFree(header_size);
74 normal_space.free_list().Add({&header, header_size});
75 // No need to update the bitmap as the same bit is reused for the free
76 // list entry.
77 }
78 }
79}
80
81namespace {
82
83bool Grow(HeapObjectHeader& header, BasePage& base_page, size_t new_size,
84 size_t size_delta) {
85 DCHECK_GE(new_size, header.AllocatedSize() + kAllocationGranularity);
86 DCHECK_GE(size_delta, kAllocationGranularity);
87 DCHECK(!base_page.is_large());
88
89 auto& normal_space = *static_cast<NormalPageSpace*>(&base_page.space());
90 auto& lab = normal_space.linear_allocation_buffer();
91 if (lab.start() == header.ObjectEnd() && lab.size() >= size_delta) {
92 // LABs are considered used memory which means that no allocated size
93 // adjustments are needed.
94 Address delta_start = lab.Allocate(size_delta);
95 SetMemoryAccessible(delta_start, size_delta);
96 header.SetAllocatedSize(new_size);
97 return true;
98 }
99 return false;
100}
101
102bool Shrink(HeapObjectHeader& header, BasePage& base_page, size_t new_size,
103 size_t size_delta) {
104 DCHECK_GE(header.AllocatedSize(), new_size + kAllocationGranularity);
105 DCHECK_GE(size_delta, kAllocationGranularity);
106 DCHECK(!base_page.is_large());
107
108 auto& normal_space = *static_cast<NormalPageSpace*>(&base_page.space());
109 auto& lab = normal_space.linear_allocation_buffer();
110 Address free_start = header.ObjectEnd() - size_delta;
111 if (lab.start() == header.ObjectEnd()) {
112 DCHECK_EQ(free_start, lab.start() - size_delta);
113 // LABs are considered used memory which means that no allocated size
114 // adjustments are needed.
115 lab.Set(free_start, lab.size() + size_delta);
116 SetMemoryInaccessible(lab.start(), size_delta);
117 header.SetAllocatedSize(new_size);
118 } else if (size_delta >= ObjectAllocator::kSmallestSpaceSize) {
119 // Heuristic: Only return memory to the free list if the block is larger
120 // than the smallest size class.
121 SetMemoryInaccessible(free_start, size_delta);
122 base_page.heap().stats_collector()->NotifyExplicitFree(size_delta);
123 normal_space.free_list().Add({free_start, size_delta});
124 NormalPage::From(&base_page)->object_start_bitmap().SetBit(free_start);
125 header.SetAllocatedSize(new_size);
126 }
127#if defined(CPPGC_YOUNG_GENERATION)
128 auto& heap = base_page.heap();
129 if (heap.generational_gc_supported()) {
130 heap.remembered_set().InvalidateRememberedSlotsInRange(
131 free_start, free_start + size_delta);
132 }
133#endif // defined(CPPGC_YOUNG_GENERATION)
134 // Return success in any case, as we want to avoid that embedders start
135 // copying memory because of small deltas.
136 return true;
137}
138
139} // namespace
140
141bool ExplicitManagementImpl::Resize(void* object, size_t new_object_size) {
142 // `object` is guaranteed to be of type GarbageCollected, so getting the
143 // BasePage is okay for regular and large objects.
144 BasePage* base_page = BasePage::FromPayload(object);
145
146 if (InGC(base_page->heap())) {
147 return false;
148 }
149
150 // TODO(chromium:1056170): Consider supporting large objects within certain
151 // restrictions.
152 if (base_page->is_large()) {
153 return false;
154 }
155
156 const size_t new_size = RoundUp<kAllocationGranularity>(
157 sizeof(HeapObjectHeader) + new_object_size);
158 auto& header = HeapObjectHeader::FromObject(object);
159 const size_t old_size = header.AllocatedSize();
160
161 if (new_size > old_size) {
162 return Grow(header, *base_page, new_size, new_size - old_size);
163 } else if (old_size > new_size) {
164 return Shrink(header, *base_page, new_size, old_size - new_size);
165 }
166 // Same size considering internal restrictions, e.g. alignment.
167 return true;
168}
169
170} // namespace internal
171} // namespace cppgc
